item.title: How to Make Anything Gameable: Ask What Three Times
item.description: So, I like to get into procedures, techniques, and tactics in a lot of aspects of my life: the nitty gritty, detailed ways to exactly do a particular thing. For some gaming related examples, check out these previous posts: creating d100 tables from media, and various procedures in the megadungeon. What I want to talk about today is how to get the most out of mining a book, comic, picture, or whatever for gameable stuff.

item.title: Starter RPG Project
item.description: Well, the first project I’m going to share progress on is my attempt to create a roleplaying game custom built to introduce new players, with a strong emphasis on quick character creation, one-off or pick up game playability, and ease of learning the rules. Here, I’m going to layout some of my general philosophy behind what I’m doing, and in later posts I’ll get into more specifics and make references to games that have influenced me.
